attributes.action: Teach young adults the struggles of owning a house.
attributes.background: I would like for schools and colleges ect, to teach young adults how hard it is to run a property of their own so when it comes to them having their own property rented, bought or shared accommodation they will know what to do when they come to the hurdles without it ending in them becoming homeless
attributes.additional_details: I strongly agree something like this should be taught budgeting, mortgages. Too many people going into the world with no life skills.

attributes.action: Start a Parliamentary debate over funding of the UK's crumbling road network
attributes.background: The UK is the 9th richest country in the world by GDP however a recent survey of the standard of its road network placed it 27th behind such countries as Namibia and Ecuador. The problems represent chronic under investment in crucial infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details:
Studies have shown patching up roads to be 10 times more expensive in the long run than resurfacing entire stretches.

Please sign this petition if you too have had enough and think it is time the funding of road maintenance was subject to a serious debate in Parliament in attempt to bring the road network of the UK to a standard where it is actually fit for purpose rather than the national embarrassment, safety hazard to road users and barrier to economic growth that it currently is.

attributes.action: I want to start a petition to ban fixed odds betting machines in all book makers
attributes.background: I want to ban all fixed odd gaming machine in all bookmakers. I think these machines exploit people and the human brain, these bookmakers spend thousands of pounds in doing this. People have ruined thier own lives and people around them lives by playing these highly addictive machines.

attributes.action: Adopt unilateral free trade with the whole world.
attributes.background: We call upon the Government to adopt Unilateral Free Trade to reduce import costs to consumers and businesses. This means removing all tariffs on goods and services, reducing non-tariff trade barriers and recognising other countries' technical standards as equivalent unilaterally.
attributes.additional_details:
Unilateral free trade is the most pragmatic and fair trade policy for Britain. End discriminatory, mercantilist policies and embrace UFT to (1) lower input costs for businesses and the poorest consumers; (2) allow negotiators to focus on services agreements; (3) stimulate domestic competition; (4) reduce red-tape; and (6) lead by example to make the moral case for free trade. 

If you are unwilling to show leadership on trade issues, Britain's consumers are more than willing to do so.

attributes.action: Redirect funds gained from taxing 'Legal Highs' to Safe Housing & Rehab Centres
attributes.background:
Formally Legal highs started out as a legal recreational drug, found in many shops in the UK and often seen in use in festivals. 
Fast forward 10 years and the now illegal  psychoactive substances leave addicts with side effects, paranoia, coma, seizures and death with no specialised support.
attributes.additional_details: Prior to the new legislation ( The Psychoactive Substances Act May 2016)  ' legal high' was the title given to  substances sold that emulated illegal drugs such as cocaine,heroin, speed, cannabis. It could be found sold in shops/festivals/online. Since the Ban was enforced these psychoactive drugs have been forced underground and are now even more dangerous. I suggest that any taxes gathered from the years that the drug was 'legal ' should be redirected in specific rehab and homeless centres.

attributes.action: Legal Protection for children under age of 16 sending images to sexual predators
attributes.background: Police are threatening to charge children for creating and disturbing child pornography when sending images of themselves to sexual predators thats grooming real children.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents are now not willing to report online child sexual exploitation crimes because of fears teens will be arrested. Currently only chikdren under the age of 13 is protected from Child porn crimes when images are off themselves. 

Why should our children face charges because someone groomed them into sending images.

attributes.action: Make all school "Keep Clear" markings mandatory zones instead of advisory.
attributes.background: Too many people ignore the Keep Clear markings around school entrances as currently they are advisory unless accompanied by signage and enforced by the local Councils. Making them compulsory No Parking zones would make school entrances safer for all.

attributes.action: Reverse central government funding cuts to councils
attributes.background: Since 2010 central government has cut the funding to councils. It is planned that by 2020 funding by central government to councils will be reduced by 77%. Causing councils to have to make MORE devastating cuts to much needed services including social care, childrens services, education, and more.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the austerity cuts councils have had to make savings, and that has led to a spiraling funding problem, causing the most vulnerable to suffer, social services at crisis point, our roads in dire need of need repair and our children services and early years cut and cut again causing generational damage. It is time to realise that the decision of 2010 by Conservative/Lib Dem government is causing untold damage to the UK, and it needs to be reversed. Put the funding back into our councils.

attributes.action: Ban Admin Fees on Insurance Policies for Legal Need to report Change of Address
attributes.background: When people move house and need to report a legal change to their address circumstances, this should NOT be subjected to punitive fees by profiteering or hidden smallprint in contracts.
attributes.additional_details: Most insurance companies now deliver documents via PDF electronically. This no longer costs them postage. A change of address is a legal requirement (along with Driving Licence and DVLA registration) Charging people a punitive administration fee for complying with the LAW only encourages people to break the law until a policy renews. Simple address changes should be exempt from these Fees irrespective of refunds/increases in policy calculations.

attributes.action: Introduce play as a statutory requirement across the primary national curriculum
attributes.background: Purposeful play is a central component of early years provision but the requirement for children to play should not end at Year 1. Play should be a requirement within the national curriculum ensuring all children are provided with opportunities for purposeful play across the primary age range.
attributes.additional_details: Play is a protected right for children under Article 31 of the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child. When planned and led effectively different types of purposeful play contribute to the spiritual, moral, social and cultural development of the child. Although some schools provide children with this opportunity beyond early years as part of their core provision this should be a requirement for all UK schools.

attributes.action: Changing a man's name after marriage.
attributes.background: Currently in the UK men are unable to use a marriage certificate as proof to change their name when taking their wife's last name. However woman are allowed to use a marriage certificate as proof to take the mans name. A man has to change his name by deed poll, a woman does not.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe in equality and for that reason a marriage certificate should be proof enough to change your name even if you are a man taking your wife's name, or a man taking your husband's name. 

Lets break the tradition and make a change.

attributes.action: Reform the UK prison system by adopting a more rehabilitative approach.
attributes.background: The UK prison system is failing. It does not meet the aims of punishment or prevention and doesn't even act as a deterrent as 47% of people leaving prison reoffend within a year (70% for those U18). This needs to change and we propose the change can come from more actively rehabilitating offenders..
attributes.additional_details: Rehabilitating offenders equips them with skills necessary to enter the world of employment. 50% of offenders have a reading age below 11 and 82% have a writing age below 11. To manage everyday tasks people need a reading age above 11 and so once offenders serve their sentence, they re-enter society with the same lack of skills they entered with. This means that they are likely to get involved with things that led them to prison in the first place, resulting in reoffending. Things must change!

attributes.action: UK residents with ILR to access EU passport or fast track queues at UK Borders
attributes.background: UK residents lose considerable time and productivity to long queues at UK Borders. A registered traveller scheme exists for frequent non-resident visitors from several countries to access faster clearance at the Border. A similar system should be implemented free of charge for residents with ILR.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/registered-traveller/eligibility

attributes.action: pay state pensions into pensioners bank accounts on the day they are due
attributes.background: if your state pension is due on say the 15th it should be in the pensinors account on the 15th  not up to 15 days later
attributes.additional_details: my state pension is allways received 5-10 days late and the pension centre say this is normal?

attributes.action: Restore expatriate Pensioners in Spain their Winter Fuel Allowance.
attributes.background: Expat Pensioners have paid into the system and require parity with Pensioners in the UK. If it is right for UK residents it must be right for Spanish expatriates to receive their allowance.
attributes.additional_details: When the temperatures drop in winter, as they do in the UK, pensioners in Spain need to burn wood to keep their homes warm - homes that have been designed to remain cold in summer become very cold in winter. A great many pensioners are not wealthy but just about surviving on their meagre pension income. The seasonal temperature variation can be as much as 50 + centrigade with the temperatures falling below 0 degrees centigrade when the Sun sets in the Winter season.

attributes.action: Make Staffordshire Bull terriers wear a harness or muzzle in public.
attributes.background:
My pet cat was savaged and killed by a Staffordshire bull terrier whilst the incompetent owner and his partner walked past my premises. 
The dog was not muzzled or in a harness, he was able to slip his lead and collar. The owner who had one arm in a sling at the time was unable to control him.
attributes.additional_details:
I am partially disabled and Ben is my only companion, this has had a devastating effect on my life. 
I reported the incident to the police and the Basildon Echo. 
The police are unable to do anything about it without identifying the owner. 
I have searched the neighbourhood and spoken with many local people but have been unable to find the owner. 
My MP encouraged me to start the petition and has spoken with the police on my behalf.

attributes.action: I want a Royal Commision to examine the Obesity Crisis in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: UK obesity dates from the almost total collapse of the once World leading UK pottery industry in Stoke on Trent. A typical plate increased from 9.5 inches to 11 inches dia. That holds 40% more nosh & we led a much more active life; no Ipads and stuff then!

attributes.action: Stop councils having to pay when planning decisions are overturned on appeal
attributes.background: Having spoken to local councillors it would appear the councils are becoming unwilling to deny planning because of the costs involved if overturned at appeal. This needs to stop or will end up with councils unwilling to do their best for the people, purely based on money.
attributes.additional_details: I feel the need to ask this question having been witness to the completely inappropriate and ill advised project to double the size of a small village in North Warwickshire.

attributes.action: Council Right To Build
attributes.background: We are calling upon the Government to grant Local Authorities the right to build and the right to buy so that housing can be let to families on low incomes at social housing rents. If the Government target of building 300,000 new homes is to be achieved, councils will have to play their part.
attributes.additional_details:
Local Authority resources are stretched to breaking point. This government has acknowledged our widespread housing crisis, but still the wait goes on for tangible action to get housebuilders building genuinely affordable homes.

The last time that 300,000 homes were built in one year in England was in 1969, when councils and housing associations were also building new homes. The private sector has never and does not have the inclination to reach these numbers.

attributes.action: Ensure Cricket Test Matches played by England are on Terrestrial TV.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State should amend the Group B list of events to include Cricket Test Matches played by England, instead of “in England”.
attributes.additional_details: It always used to be the case that sporting events of national significance had to be shown in some form (live or substantial highlights) on terrestrial television. For the first time BT has a monopoly on both live and highlight packages of the Ashes.

attributes.action: Make rent to own companies illegal
attributes.background: Some companies’ lending practices are targeting the "poorest, most desperate families" and operating in the "most deprived areas" of the UK. The customers end up paying more than twice what they would have paid without finance charges. This is making people already in debt further in debt.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that they are targeting the UK's most vulnerable (poorest and most desperate families), and operating in the most deprived areas. Customers end up paying more than twice what they would have paid without finance charges. Some base prices have also been noted to be higher than those of upscale mainstream retailers such as Harrods. This is totally unacceptable, with the interest rates in need of review.

attributes.action: Stop sending our Foreign aid money to countries with no animal rights
attributes.background: We give huge sums of our taxes to countries like China, Vietnam, Pakistan etc where animals both domestic and farmed are given no protection whatsoever from abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Countless petitions to these Governments pleading to stop atrocities like Yulin Dog Eating 'Festival' or Vietnamese slaughtering cattle with a sledgehammer seem to fall on deaf ears. I propose we stop our taxes being donated as foreign aid to these countries and I believe that 'money talks' so perhaps they will listen!
Sign and share please, let's see where this goes!

attributes.action: Grant Bees legal protection under The Animal Welfare Act 2006.
attributes.background: We have over 250 species of Bee in the UK, all playing a role in our eco-system, food chain and agricultural success. Since the 1980's the Bee population has declined, which, if left to continue will have an untold impact on the mental, physical and economical welfare of everyone in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Animal Welfare Act 2006 an animal is only granted legal protection if it is a Vertebrate. This leaves Bees with very little in the way of physical or environmental protection.
Classing Bees as a species to be protected under the AWA 2006, means better action against those who threaten the population, whether they be individuals or industries, in the long term providing a better quality of life for us as a species, as well as the numerous native species we share our country with.

attributes.action: Have another general election
attributes.background: I don't believe that May is the correct person to take the UK forward and would therefore like another general election.

attributes.action: Dissolve the Northern Ireland Assembly with immediate effect
attributes.background:
The Northern Ireland Assembly has failed all of the people of Northern Ireland.
As a direct consequence of MLA’s refusing to take their seats within the Government the country is failing.
The people have a right to have direction and leadership which the current Assembly is not providing.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for urinals to have a partition that offers privacy
attributes.background: Urinating and exposing yourself in a public toilet is an uncomfortable situation at the best of times. It's time a privacy partition is installed in all toilets across the country, and give us the privacy we deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Just because we can urinate in public, does not mean we like exposing ourselves.

Nearly 4 million people in the UK are affected by paruresis or shy bladder syndrome, which can be a physically and socially uncomfortable condition. 
 
We need to make it a legal requirement for all urinals across the country to have decent privacy and help people conquer toilet anxiety.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of confectionery at the checkout in all UK shops
attributes.background: The UK is facing a huge obesity crisis, which is placing increasing pressure on the NHS. This petition calls for a ban on the sale of confectionery at the checkout in all UK shops (excluding confectionery shops) to stop consumers impulse buying confectionery they would otherwise not have bought.
attributes.additional_details:
The obesity crisis that the UK is facing is unprecedented. To tackle this issue, more preventative measures ought to be taken. This petition offers such an idea. A simple idea, but one that can make a difference.
References: 
BBC programme - Britain's Fat Fight with Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall
Article: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-43838655
NHS on obesity: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/obesity/
Find out your BMI: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-43697948
See also NHS Digital UK obesity stats.

attributes.action: Grants for wash/dry toilets installed in households. Stop use of wipes/tissue.
attributes.background: There is currently a lot  in the media about how harmful the use of toilet wipes is on the environment and marine life. It is also costly to clear up and provide necessary protection. Providing access to grant aided/discounted wash and dry toilets should help to greatly minimise this. SaveOurPlanet!

attributes.action: Revert the Design & Technology Resistant Materials GCSE to its prior curriculum
attributes.background:
I signed up to make stuff
Now I am learning about cotton
I did not sign up for this

attributes.action: Make it illegal for prisoners to share a cell.
attributes.background:
Prison is a very stressful and violent environment. People are placed there to be so called "reabilitated'.
In order for a prisoner to progress, inmates should not have to endure the added suffering that is to share a cell.
How would you feel if you had to go to the toilet in front of a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand prison is place for people who broke the law but prison nowadays are full of people suffering from mental health issues who should not be there in the first place.
Prisons are the new "Asylums" and inmates suffering from mental health issues are particularly vulnerable in a cell sharing scenario.
Prison is about the loss of freedom, not suffering further torture while inside one.

attributes.action: Scrap the 2 child limit on the benefits system
attributes.background: Limiting the children in the benefit system to 2 only. is causing unfair hardship on families.Some single mothers have absent fathers. who if forced to pay out benefits can pay as little as £1.50 pw, with no government help. how can this be fair upon the child they abandoned..

attributes.action: Provide mental health training to all teachers
attributes.background: Specialised mental health training for teachers will help them to identify children with mental health issues and get them the help they need. I want an end to the stigma.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to get a licence to own an animal.
attributes.background: This is a petition to make anybody who wants to own any animal have a licence. There is so much animal abuse that goes on and this is a step in the right direction to start protecting innocent creatures. With a view to the licence fee being used to police animal cruelty at street level.
attributes.additional_details: The licence would ideally be linked with an animal abusers register that is also being petitioned for. Please remember that if nobody speaks up, nothing will change, and animals do not have a voice. We are their voice and we have to be heard. Thankyou.

attributes.action: Debt agencies should only charge a small percentage fee for recovery of any debt
attributes.background: Companies and debt agencies should only be allowed to charge a very small percentage fee for any recovery of debts.
attributes.additional_details: Debt is a nationwide epidemic, companies and debt agencies have been exploiting people’s financial difficulties, and charging excessive amounts of money to recover any debt, often pushing people into further debt, and even bankruptcies and/or debt relief orders. Writing people off financially for years and sometimes preventing them from ever getting back on there financial feet again. Debt is a very stressful, experience causing anxiety, depression and even suicides. It’s time to change the la !

attributes.action: Prohibit operating tractors & other agricultural vehicles between 07:30 - 09:00
attributes.background: A tailback of cars stretching miles behind a tractor during rush hour in the morning is a sight many of the British public are accustomed to. Their use not only causes huge delays to travel times but puts other drivers at risk of incident as a result of forced manoeuvre.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us have experienced considerable delays due to these vehicles, whose operation at peak rush hour is generally dispensible and subservient at these hours. Tractors also breed anger into the drivers who are stuck behind them, with no hope of manoeuvring unless subjecting themselves to an incident. The difference in time between agricultural vehicles travelling at 8am rather than 9am is negligible and should be considered when contemplating this petition.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for freeholders to receive insurance commission over 10%
attributes.background: Landlords and/or their associates receive hidden commission on buildings insurance at the expense of leasehold owners, and this is often grossly excessive.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous Lands Tribunal cases correcting this but this would not be necessary if it was made law.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for horse owners to pick up their horse droppings
attributes.background: Living in a rural village in Berkshire I often see a lot of horse pooh in the road and never once a person cleaning it up, after my 6 and 8 year old sons pointing this out, why dog owners do why don’t horse owners it is unsanitary to surely in this day and age?

attributes.action: To allow Tyler, the Creator back into the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In 2015, Tyler, the Creator (an American rapper) was banned from the United Kingdom on “behaviours unacceptable in the UK.” People make mistakes especially at a young age. What Tyler promotes is music which people adore and has matured as most people do. He's been banned from lyrics he wrote in 2009
attributes.additional_details: Tyler has changed as seen in his new music and album released in 2017, which is appealing to at least many thousands of fans in the United Kingdom and does not promote violence as he does not ever promote or perform those songs. His punishment has been too extreme for someone who has used ill lyrics at a poor time which many other celebrities have used worse. The people of the United Kingdom want to see him perform again.

attributes.action: 2 year prison sentence for carrying knives
attributes.background: Too many of our young bright teenagers are dying needlessly on a daily basis, robbing parents of their children and brothers and sisters losing a loved one. Far too many teenagers are carrying knives, who's only use is for causing injury or death.
attributes.additional_details: Please look at the news every day to see that knife crime is getting out of control, and the government appear to be too weak to take the action necessary to reduce/stop this. Carrying a knife should mean a mandatory 2 year minimum prison term

attributes.action: Urge the UN to refer Southern Cameroons (SC) impasse to the ICJ.
attributes.background: There are serious human rights violations taking place in the Anglophone-speaking areas of Cameroon including killings, arrests, torture, disappearances, rape and the razing of whole villages after protests against assimilation. The SC impasse must be referred to the ICJ to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
In 1961, instead of properly decolonising SC, Britain and the United Nations effectively annexed SC to RC. After unjustly ruling out full independence for SC, the self rule envisaged by UNGA Res 1608 (XV) of 21/04/61 in a federation of two states equal in status was never properly implemented. Today, our Anglo-Saxon educational, legal, economic and socio-cultural systems are under attack by RC assimilationists. 

We want the ICJ to rule in favour of a referendum for us to determine our future.

attributes.action: Automatic British Citizenship for Indefinite Leave to Remainers settled 15 years
attributes.background: My parents immigrated to the UK with my sister and I in 1988. I obtained ILR status in 2001 having lived in the U.K. since aged 2, gone to university and worked here all my life. It’s not fair to have to sit a test and pay £1330 to become Naturalised. Britain has been my home all my life.
attributes.additional_details: I am 31 years old. I have lived in the U.K. for 29 years.  I have had ILR status since 2001 (for 17 years). It is not fair to have to sit a life in the UK test and pay £1330 to become naturalised. I’ve gone to nursery, primary school, secondary school and  University and spent my whole working life in the U.K. The Government even recognise my 9 month old daughter as British so why do I have to pay over the odds when I pay tax and national insurance and have done my whole working life!

attributes.action: Require all toll bridges to treat disabled people equally
attributes.background: The Government must require parity for all disabled people to use toll bridges and roads for free, not just those on Disability Living Allowance. For example, I’m disabled but too old to qualify for disability living allowance which means I can’t use the Dartford river crossing for free.
attributes.additional_details: As a blue badge holder I can go through London without paying the congestion charge surely it should be the same using the Dartford river crossing. This is free for people who receive Disability Living Allowance and has an exemption from paying vehicle tax as a result. However anyone in my position is still required to pay due to being too old to apply for Disability Living Allowance.

attributes.action: Ban the use of high-frequency sonic deterrents against young people
attributes.background:
'Mosquitos' are devices deployed outside shops in public areas, with the aim of deterring loitering. They output high-energy 17400Hz waves, only heard by children and young adults.

This 108-decibel assault is painful, causes headaches, and discriminates against all young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Mosquito use infringes on section 14 (discrimination) of the European Convention on Human Rights and the Human Rights Act 1998. The Council of Europe has recommended in 2010 that it be banned.

Mosquito emissions are irritating, painful, and have been compared to forms of torture.

Kent County Council have already banned these on council-owned buildings - why are the Government not at least doing the same?

attributes.action: Impose a safety check on all animal toys
attributes.background: Animals are just seen as pets to most but to many they are like a family member. Children's toys have to pass a safety check so animal toys should have to too. This issue needs addressing urgently.
attributes.additional_details: There's been many pet deaths caused by pet toys. My friends dog nearly died through playing with a dog toy and my dog was playing tug with one of her toys which the inside was sticking out. A very sharp plastic tube is the only way I can describe it held together with a small piece of sellotape hidden under woven rope. This could have caused my dog serious harm.

attributes.action: If you are an English citizen, you should not have to pay to attend university.
attributes.background: In Scotland, you do not have to pay to attend university, however, English citizens have to pay extortionate amounts just to get education. Without this education, many young people will not get the chances that their futures' deserve. You can change all this with just a vote.

attributes.action: Bring back nit nurse to UK schools send them home till treated and clear 2018
attributes.background:
Sick of nits £££ on products such as treatments and repellents.
Hours spent combing through hair.
Laundry through constant washing.
Kids crying you pulling and tugging to the point you want to shave their head.
attributes.additional_details:
Abroad they still have nit nurses that come to check children’s heads in school regularly, once head lice are found the child is sent home and not allowed to return till rechecked and cleared.
I lived abroad and this works 100%.
Eliminates before it can even start to spread.
Desperate mum of a girl with beautiful long hair that seriously can’t take this anymore.

attributes.action: Start development of a satellite carrier rocket.
attributes.background: During the 1960s a British rocket named Black Arrow was created that was capable of launching payloads into orbit. However, the program was cancelled in order to save money which left the UK the only country to successfully develop and then cancel an indigenous space rocket.
attributes.additional_details:
-Black Arrow was cancelled in order to save cost, however it was a comparatively cheap rocket design.
-All other countries that have successfully developed rocket technologies have continued to develop them further.
-The lack of our own launch system has led us to rely on foreign countries, such as the Russian Soyuz rocket, which we could be prevented from using their equipment if we fall out of favour with their governments.

attributes.action: Increase the driving age to 21
attributes.background: I believe that being able to drive at 17 is far too young and the age limit should be increased to 21 to try and save lives

attributes.action: Let contraceptives be sold over-the-counter
attributes.background: Contraceptives are currently not sold over-the-counter, you have to get a prescription for one. I believe that this should change. Many people require contraceptive pills and other forms of contraception for different reasons, and they have to go through too much hassle. Make pills over the counter!
attributes.additional_details: People need contraceptives. Women and men - regardless of sexuality - need them to stop STIs and unplanned pregnancies. Transgender men who aren't on HRT can use them to stop their periods, and they may have a judgmental family who would treat them harshly if they found out this was why they were getting contraception - especially 13-to-16-year-olds. Making contraceptives over-the-counter will benefit so many people in terms of health and confidentiality, so what are we waiting for?

attributes.action: Introduce new regulations for the development of Artificial Intelligence.
attributes.background: Artificial Intelligence is intelligent behaviour, exhibited by computers. Currently AI is at a primitive stage, home assistants are starting to play a role in our lives, but what they can do for us is limited. I want to see new regulations, for further development of AI and Machine Learning.
attributes.additional_details:
Many experts, including founder of Microsoft, Bill Gates, and Professor Stephen Hawking, have raised concerns over the development of AI. Many in particular believe that, by 2045, the point of Technological Singularity will occur. This means that, if AI is developed, without regulation, it could surpass human intelligence.

AI is useful at the present time, however, continuing to develop this, without limits, is dangerous. Machines will always make mistakes, let's not become inferior to them.
